item.title: Former UCLA Labor Center director, workers’ rights advocate Kent Wong dies at 69
item.description: Kent Wong, the former director of the UCLA Labor Center and an advocate for workers’ rights, died Oct. 8. He was 69 years old. Wong was the director of the UCLA Labor Center from 1991 to 2023, during which he oversaw the 2021 development of its new MacArthur Park headquarters, said Toby Higbie, a professor of history and labor studies.
item.source:markdown: Kent Wong, the former director of the UCLA Labor Center and an advocate for workers’ rights, died Oct. 8. He was 69 years old. Wong was the director of the UCLA Labor Center from 1991 to 2023, during which he oversaw the 2021 development of its new MacArthur Park headquarters, said Toby Higbie, a professor of history and labor studies.

item.title: UC Investments offers $2.4 billion for stake in new Big Ten entity
item.description: UC Investments offered $2.4 billion for a 10% stake in a new entity that would manage the Big Ten’s league-wide media rights and sponsorship deals. The UC said it would use a pension fund to invest in Big Ten Enterprises, which would then direct funds to individual Big Ten schools’ athletic departments, according to ESPN.
item.source:markdown: UC Investments offered $2.4 billion for a 10% stake in a new entity that would manage the Big Ten’s league-wide media rights and sponsorship deals. The UC said it would use a pension fund to invest in Big Ten Enterprises, which would then direct funds to individual Big Ten schools’ athletic departments, according to ESPN.

item.title: Men’s basketball’s Steven Jamerson II leaves his comfort zone, proves resilience
item.description: Basketball coaches often prioritize teaching their pupils how to pivot with the ball. The technique prevents a player from “traveling.” Before developing dribbling expertise, basketball players must master the craft – Kyrie Irving did not become “Uncle Drew” without first learning how to pivot.
item.source:markdown: Basketball coaches often prioritize teaching their pupils how to pivot with the ball. The technique prevents a player from “traveling.” Before developing dribbling expertise, basketball players must master the craft – Kyrie Irving did not become “Uncle Drew” without first learning how to pivot.

item.title: Album review: Demi Lovato’s ‘It’s Not That Deep’ fails to cut deep with bland, derivative songs
item.description: Dance music can be as deep as the artist wants it to be, a truth Demi Lovato seems aware of. Lovato’s ninth studio album, “It’s Not That Deep,” released Friday, marking the pop star’s first LP of new material since 2022’s rock-leaning “HOLY FVCK.” With 11 tracks – seven of which are less than three minutes long – across just over 32 minutes of music, “It’s Not That Deep” is also the singer-songwriter’s shortest album to date.
item.source:markdown: Dance music can be as deep as the artist wants it to be, a truth Demi Lovato seems aware of. Lovato’s ninth studio album, “It’s Not That Deep,” released Friday, marking the pop star’s first LP of new material since 2022’s rock-leaning “HOLY FVCK.” With 11 tracks – seven of which are less than three minutes long – across just over 32 minutes of music, “It’s Not That Deep” is also the singer-songwriter’s shortest album to date.

item.title: Scouting report: UCLA men’s soccer vs. Michigan
item.description: UCLA men’s soccer (3-5-3, 3-2-1 Big Ten) will face off against No. 16 Michigan (7-2-3, 3-2-1) in Ann Arbor, Michigan, Friday night. Although the Wolverines may boast a better overall record than the Bruins, both teams share the same conference record and are coming off wins against Big Ten opponents, with UCLA defeating Penn State last Friday and Michigan besting Ohio State Tuesday.
item.source:markdown: UCLA men’s soccer (3-5-3, 3-2-1 Big Ten) will face off against No. 16 Michigan (7-2-3, 3-2-1) in Ann Arbor, Michigan, Friday night. item.title: Federal funding application process, impact of loss of funding for researchers
item.description: This post was updated Oct. 17 at 1:40 p.m. UCLA and the Trump Administration have been at odds over federal funding for months. In July, The Trump administration suspended an estimated $584 million of research funding to UCLA, alleging that the university failed to protect Jewish and Israeli students from antisemitism, implemented affirmative action in their admission practices and allegedly allowed “men to participate in women’s sports.” While a federal judge ordered the restoration of most of the funding, the struggle breaks a long tradition of cooperation between university institutions and the federal government in research development.
item.source:markdown: _This post was updated Oct. 17 at 1:40 p.m._ UCLA and the Trump Administration have been at odds over federal funding for months. In July, The Trump administration suspended an estimated $584 million of research funding to UCLA, alleging that the university failed to protect Jewish and Israeli students from antisemitism, implemented affirmative action in their admission practices and allegedly allowed “men to participate in women’s sports.” While a federal judge ordered the restoration of most of the funding, the struggle breaks a long tradition of cooperation between university institutions and the federal government in research development.

item.title: UCLA women’s volleyball sweeps, upsets USC at Pauley Pavilion
item.description: One play can alter a match’s trajectory. And after falling behind 11-2 to open the match, a kill from graduate student middle blocker Phekran Kong sparked a 9-2 run to help spur the Bruins’ early comeback.

item.description: The Big Ten has always been hailed as a football conference. It ranks fifth in national championships in men’s NCAA tournament history with 10 titles, and a Big Ten team has not been dancing at the end of March since 2002, when Maryland took home the one shining moment.

item.title: UCLA men’s soccer twirls past Penn State, breaking three-game winless streak
item.description: Spinning 360 degrees is generally reserved for sports like gymnastics, ice skating and ballet. Rarely would the move be associated with soccer. But junior forward Oliver Roche proved that twirling is not just for artistic disciplines Friday night when he did a complete over-the-shoulder spin before striking the ball with his nondominant foot and drilling it into the left corner of the net.
item.source:markdown: Spinning 360 degrees is generally reserved for sports like gymnastics, ice skating and ballet. Rarely would the move be associated with soccer. But junior forward Oliver Roche proved that twirling is not just for artistic disciplines Friday night when he did a complete over-the-shoulder spin before striking the ball with his nondominant foot and drilling it into the left corner of the net.

item.title: Scouting report: UCLA football vs. Michigan State
item.source:markdown: For the curious eyes that peeked into the windows of the Wasserman Football Center on Tuesday afternoon, the same five-word message could be seen on every weight room television screen: “Are we one-hit wonders?” Following one of the most improbable upsets of the 2025 college football season, UCLA football (1-4, 1-1 Big Ten) will have the opportunity to answer this looming question when it heads to East Lansing to take on Michigan State (3-2, 0-2).
